7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.
7.caption: Custom Action

8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.
8.caption: Approved

9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.
9.caption: Restored

10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).
10.caption: Exonerated

11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.
11.caption: Corrected

12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.
12.caption: Partially Corrected

14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.
14.caption: Delayed

15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.
15.caption: Detected

16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.
16.caption: No Action

17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.
17.caption: Logged

18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.
18.caption: Tagged

20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.
20.caption: Count

21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.
21.caption: Reset

22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.
22.caption: Captcha

23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.
23.caption: Challenge

24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.
24.caption: Access Revoked

25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.
25.caption: Rejected

26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.
26.caption: Unauthorized

27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.
27.caption: Error

13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.
13.caption: Uncorrected

19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.
19.caption: Alert

disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.
disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID

duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.
duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds

osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.
osint.caption: OSINT

99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.
confidence_id.caption: Confidence ID

unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.
unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data

risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.
risk_details.caption: Risk Details

application_error.name: application_error
application_error.description: Application Error events describe issues with an applications. The error message should be put in the event's message attribute. The metadata.product attribute can be used to capture the originating application information. The host profile can used to include the generating device information. This class is helpful (and originally intended for) applications that generate and/or handle OCSF events. This class can also be used for errors in upstream products and services.
application_error.caption: Application Error

count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.
count.caption: Count

message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.
message.caption: Message

status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.
status.caption: Status

time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.
time.caption: Event Time

metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.
metadata.caption: Metadata

start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.
start_time.caption: Start Time

severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.
severity.caption: Severity

duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.
duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds

timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.
timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset

99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.
activity_id.caption: Activity ID

0.description: The base event is a generic and concrete event. It also defines a set of attributes available in most event classes. As a generic event that does not belong to any event category, it could be used to log events that are not otherwise defined by the schema.
0.caption: Base Event

class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.
class_uid.caption: Class ID

type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.
type_uid.caption: Type ID

raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.
raw_data.caption: Raw Data

unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.
unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data

type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.
type_name.caption: Type Name

category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.
category_uid.caption: Category ID

observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.
observables.caption: Observables

category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value.
category_name.caption: Category

class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Base Event.
class_name.caption: Class

end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.
end_time.caption: End Time

activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.
activity_name.caption: Activity

enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]
enrichments.caption: Enrichments

raw_data_size.description: The size of the raw data which was transformed into an OCSF event, in bytes.
raw_data_size.caption: Raw Data Size

3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.
3.caption: Medium

6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.
6.caption: Fatal

1.description: Informational message. No action required.
1.caption: Informational

2.description: The user decides if action is needed.
2.caption: Low

99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

4.description: Action is required immediately.
4.caption: High

5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.
5.caption: Critical

severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.
severity_id.caption: Severity ID

status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.
status_code.caption: Status Code

status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.
status_detail.caption: Status Detail

99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.
status_id.caption: Status ID

base_event.name: base_event
base_event.description: The base event is a generic and concrete event. It also defines a set of attributes available in most event classes. As a generic event that does not belong to any event category, it could be used to log events that are not otherwise defined by the schema.
base_event.caption: Base Event

event_code.description: The Event ID, Code, or Name that the product uses to primarily identify the event.
event_code.caption: Event Code

key_uid.description: The unique identifier of the key. See specific usage.
key_uid.caption: Key UID

http_headers.description: Additional HTTP headers of an HTTP request or response.
http_headers.caption: HTTP Headers

analytic.description: The analytic technique used to analyze and derive insights from the data or information that led to the finding or conclusion.
analytic.caption: Analytic

keyboard_layout.description: The keyboard locale identifier name (e.g., en-US).
keyboard_layout.caption: Keyboard Layout

status_details.description: A list of descriptions, containing additional information about the event/finding status.
status_details.caption: Status Details

manager.description: The user's manager. This helps in understanding an org hierarchy. This should only ever be populated once in an event. I.e. there should not be a manager's manager in an event.
manager.caption: Manager

finding.description: The Finding object provides details about a finding/detection generated by a security tool.
finding.caption: Finding

evidences.description: A collection of evidence artifacts associated to the activity/activities that triggered a finding. See specific usage.
evidences.caption: Evidence Artifacts

peripheral_device.description: The peripheral device that triggered the event.
peripheral_device.caption: Peripheral Device

scale_factor.description: The numeric scale factor of display.
scale_factor.caption: Scale Factor

ou_uid.description: The alternate identifier for an entity's unique identifier. For example, its Active Directory OU DN or AWS OU ID.
ou_uid.caption: Org Unit ID

accessor.description: The name of the user who last accessed the object.
accessor.caption: Accessor

orchestrator.description: The orchestrator managing the container, such as ECS, EKS, K8s, or OpenShift.
orchestrator.caption: Orchestrator

exit_code.description: The exit code reported by a process when it terminates. The convention is that zero indicates success and any non-zero exit code indicates that some error occurred.
exit_code.caption: Exit Code

entity.description: The managed entity that is being acted upon.
entity.caption: Entity

flags.description: The list of communication flags, normalized to the captions of the flag_ids values. See specific usage.
flags.caption: Flags

scheme.description: The scheme portion of the URL. For example: http, https, ftp, or sftp.
scheme.caption: Scheme

class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.
class_uid.caption: Class ID

service.description: The service that pertains to the event.
service.caption: Service

overall_score.description: The overall score as reported by the event source. See specific usage.
overall_score.caption: Overall Score

total.description: The total number of items. See specific usage.
total.caption: Total

99.description: The Domain/URL category is not mapped. See the categories attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

transmit_time.description: The event transmission time from one device to another.  See specific usage.
transmit_time.caption: Transmission Time

section_d.description: The 'd' section of the JA4 fingerprint.
section_d.caption: JA4 Section D

dependency_chain.description: Information about the chain of dependencies related to the issue as reported by an Application Security or Vulnerability Management tool. E.g., serverless-offline -> @serverless/utils -> memoizee -> es5-ext.
dependency_chain.caption: Dependency Chain

affected_code.description: List of Affected Code objects that describe details about code blocks identified as vulnerable.
affected_code.caption: Affected Code

occurrences.description: A list of occurrence_details objects, each describing where in the target entity the specified information was discovered. See specific usage.
occurrences.caption: Occurrences

lease_dur.description: This represents the length of the DHCP lease in seconds. This is present in DHCP Ack events.
lease_dur.caption: Lease Duration

zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.
zone.caption: Network Zone

delay.description: The total round-trip delay to the reference clock in milliseconds.
delay.caption: Root Delay

devices.description: The object describes details related to the list of devices.
devices.caption: Devices

span.description: The information about the span. See specific usage.
span.caption: Span

trace.description: The information about the trace. See specific usage.
trace.caption: Trace

related_events.description: Describes events and/or other findings related to the finding as identified by the security product. Note that these events may or may not be in OCSF.
related_events.caption: Related Events/Findings

is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.
is_system.caption: System

query_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) query time.
query_time.caption: Query Time

web_resources_result.description: The results of the activity on web resources. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes of the web resources.
web_resources_result.caption: Web Resources Result

is_managed.description: The event occurred on a managed device.
is_managed.caption: Managed Device

depth.description: The CVSS depth represents a depth of the equation used to calculate CVSS score.
depth.caption: CVSS Depth

dce_rpc.description: The DCE/RPC object describes the remote procedure call system for distributed computing environments.
dce_rpc.caption: Distributed Computing Environment/Remote Procedure Call (DCE/RPC)

containers.description: When working with containerized applications, the set of containers which write to the standard the output of a particular logging driver. For example, this may be the set of containers involved in handling api requests and responses for a containerized application.
containers.caption: Containers

tactics.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or tactic name that are associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK® Matrix.
tactics.caption: Tactics

code.description: The numeric response sent to a request.
code.caption: Response Code

enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]
enrichments.caption: Enrichments

cwe.description: The CWE object represents a weakness in a software system that can be exploited by a threat actor to perform an attack. The CWE object is based on the Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) catalog.
cwe.caption: CWE

occurrence_details.description: Details about where in the target entity the specified information was discovered. See specific usage.
occurrence_details.caption: Occurrence Details

fingerprint.description: The digital fingerprint associated with an object.
fingerprint.caption: Fingerprint

references.description: A list of reference URLs supporting the finding/detection.
references.caption: References

cc_mailboxes.description: The human-readable email header Cc Mailbox values. For example 'Example User <example.user@usersdomain.com>'.
cc_mailboxes.caption: Cc Mailboxes

is_read.description: The indication of whether the email has been read.
is_read.caption: Read

json_path.description: The JSON path of the attribute. See specific usage.
json_path.caption: JSON Path

next_run_time.description: The next run time. See specific usage.
next_run_time.caption: Next Run

@deprecated.message: Use the labels or tags attribute instead.

firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that triggered the event.
firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule

tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs attached to an entity. A Tag may be used to categorize, filter, and search for entities. For e.g. "Environment": "Production", "Owner": "007". See specific usage.
tags.caption: Tags

lang.description: The two letter lower case language codes, as defined by ISO 639-1. For example: en (English), de (German), or fr (French).
lang.caption: Language

related_events_count.description: Number of related events or findings.
related_events_count.caption: Related Events/Findings Count

remote_display.description: The remote display affiliated with the event
remote_display.caption: Remote Display

security_states.description: The current security states. See specific usage.
security_states.caption: Security States

3.description: A user or device logged onto this device from the network.
3.caption: Network

1.description: Used only by the System account, for example at system startup.
1.caption: System

2.description: A local logon to device console.
2.caption: Interactive

99.description: The logon type is not mapped. See the logon_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

4.description: A batch server logon, where processes may be executing on behalf of a user without their direct intervention.
4.caption: Batch

5.description: A logon by a service or daemon that was started by the OS.
5.caption: OS Service

7.description: A user unlocked the device.
7.caption: Unlock

8.description: A user logged on to this device from the network. The user's password in the authentication package was not hashed.
8.caption: Network Cleartext

9.description: A caller cloned its current token and specified new credentials for outbound connections. The new logon session has the same local identity, but uses different credentials for other network connections.
9.caption: New Credentials

10.description: A remote logon using Terminal Services or remote desktop application.
10.caption: Remote Interactive

11.description: A user logged on to this device with network credentials that were stored locally on the device and the domain controller was not contacted to verify the credentials.
11.caption: Cached Interactive

12.description: Same as Remote Interactive. This is used for internal auditing.
12.caption: Cached Remote Interactive

13.description: Workstation logon.
13.caption: Cached Unlock

exploit_requirement.description: The requirement description related to any constraints around exploit execution.
exploit_requirement.caption: Exploit Requirement

last_seen_time.description: The most recent detection time of the activity or object. See specific usage.
last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen

data_sources.description: A list of data sources utilized in generation of the finding.
data_sources.caption: Data Sources

cmd_line.description: The full command line used to launch an application, service, process, or job. For example: ssh user@10.0.0.10. If the command line is unavailable or missing, the empty string '' is to be used.
cmd_line.caption: Command Line

99.description: The classification is not mapped. See the classifications attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

classification_ids.description: The list of normalized classification identifiers. See specific usage.
classification_ids.caption: Classification IDs

confidence.description: The confidence, normalized to the caption of the confidence_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.
confidence.caption: Confidence

sequence.description: Sequence number of the event. The sequence number is a value available in some events, to make the exact ordering of events unambiguous, regardless of the event time precision.
sequence.caption: Sequence Number

end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period. See specific usage.
end_time_dt.caption: End Time

auth_type.description: The agreed upon authentication type, normalized to the caption of 'auth_type_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.
auth_type.caption: Authentication Type

geodetic_vertical_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on geodetic altitude. This is based on ADS-B Geodetic Vertical Accuracy (GVA). Measured in meters.
geodetic_vertical_accuracy.caption: Geodetic Vertical Accuracy

invoked_by.description: The name of the service that invoked the activity as described in the event.
invoked_by.caption: Invoked by

http_status.description: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) status code returned to the client.
http_status.caption: HTTP Status

first_seen_time.description: The initial detection time of the activity or object. See specific usage
first_seen_time.caption: First Seen

mitigation.description: The Mitigation object describes the MITRE ATT&CK® or ATLAS™ Mitigation ID and/or name that is associated to an attack.
mitigation.caption: MITRE Mitigation

severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.
severity.caption: Severity

uploaded_time.description: The timestamp at which an entity was uploaded. See specific usage.
uploaded_time.caption: Uploaded Time

risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.
risk_score.caption: Risk Score

sni.description: The Server Name Indication (SNI) extension sent by the client.
sni.caption: Server Name Indication

is_vpn.description: The indication of whether the session is a VPN session.
is_vpn.caption: VPN Session

architecture.description: Architecture is a shorthand name describing the type of computer hardware the packaged software is meant to run on.
architecture.caption: Architecture

job.description: The job object that pertains to the event.
job.caption: Job

encryption_details.description: The encryption details of a file or other content. See specific usage.
encryption_details.caption: Encryption Details

is_shared.description: The event occurred on a shared device.
is_shared.caption: Shared Device

category.description: The object category, normalized to the caption of category_id. See specific usage.
category.caption: Category

country.description:
The ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code.

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.
country.caption: Country

system_call.description: The system call that was invoked.
system_call.caption: System Call

digest.description: The message digest attribute contains the fixed length message hash representation and the corresponding hashing algorithm information.
digest.caption: Message Digest

alert.description: The integer value of TLS alert if present. The alerts are defined in the TLS specification in RFC-2246.
alert.caption: Client TLS Alert

assessments.description: A list of assessment objects. See specific usage.
assessments.caption: Assessments

http_response.description: The HTTP Response from a web server to a requester.
http_response.caption: HTTP Response

analysis_targets.description: The specific dimensions, components, or aspects of the system that are the targets of the analysis. See specific usage.
analysis_targets.caption: Analysis Targets

start_column.description: The start column number. See specific usage.
start_column.caption: Start Column

create_mask.description: The original Windows mask that is required to create the object.
create_mask.caption: Create Mask

activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.
activity_name.caption: Activity

1.description: The related domain enables the signing of DNS records using DNSSEC.
1.caption: Signed

2.description: The related domain does not enable the signing of DNS records using DNSSEC.
2.caption: Unsigned

99.description: The DNSSEC status is not mapped. See the dnssec_status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

dnssec_status_id.description: Describes the normalized status of DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC) for a domain.
dnssec_status_id.caption: DNSSEC Status ID

intrusion_sets.description: A grouping of adversarial behaviors and resources believed to be associated with specific threat actors or campaigns. Intrusion sets often encompass multiple campaigns and are used to organize related activities under a common label.
intrusion_sets.caption: Intrusion Sets

created_time_dt.description: The time when the object was created. See specific usage.
created_time_dt.caption: Created Time

verdict.description: The verdict assigned to an Incident finding.
verdict.caption: Verdict

device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.
device.caption: Device

is_deleted.description: Indicates if the entity was deleted. See specific usage.
is_deleted.caption: Deleted

99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

parent_uid.description: The unique identifier of an object's parent object. See specific usage.
parent_uid.caption: Parent Unique ID

security_level.description: The current security level of the entity
security_level.caption: Security Level

app_uid.description: The unique ID of the application associated with the event or object.
app_uid.caption: Application ID

is_default.description: The indication of whether the value is from a default value name. For example, the value name could be missing.
is_default.caption: Default Value

match_details.description: The data in a request that rule matched. For example: '["10","and","1"]'.
match_details.caption: Match Details

vertical_speed.description: Vertical speed upward relative to the WGS-84 datum, measured in meters per second. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: 63 m/s.
vertical_speed.caption: Vertical Speed

model.description: The model name of an entity. See specific usage.
model.caption: Model

observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.
observables.caption: Observables

boot_uid.description: A unique identifier of the device that changes after every reboot. For example, the value of /proc/sys/kernel/random/boot_id from Linux's procfs.
boot_uid.caption: Boot UID

web_resources.description: Describes details about web resources that were affected by an activity/event.
web_resources.caption: Web Resources

is_trusted.description: The event occurred on a trusted device.
is_trusted.caption: Trusted Device

boundary.description:
The boundary of the connection, normalized to the caption of 'boundary_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

For cloud connections, this translates to the traffic-boundary(same VPC, through IGW, etc.). For traditional networks, this is described as Local, Internal, or External.
boundary.caption: Boundary

observation_parameter.description: The name of the parameter being analyzed or monitored. This generally identifies the specific characteristic or property being measured. See specific usage.
observation_parameter.caption: Observation Parameter

duration_weeks.description: Represents the duration of the activity in weeks. See specific usage.
duration_weeks.caption: Duration Weeks

prev_security_states.description: The previous security states. See specific usage.
prev_security_states.caption: Previous Security States

key_length.description: The length of the encryption key.
key_length.caption: Key Length

response.description: General Purpose API Response Object. See specific usage.
response.caption: API Response Details

attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing identified tactics, techniques & sub-techniques. The objects are compatible with MITRE ATLAS™ tactics, techniques & sub-techniques.
attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® and ATLAS™ Details

state.description: The state of the event or object, normalized to the caption of the state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.
state.caption: State

dkim_signature.description: The DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) signature used by the sending/receiving system.
dkim_signature.caption: DKIM Signature

actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity. Note that this is not the threat actor of a campaign but may be part of a campaign.
actor.caption: Actor

radius.description: Farthest horizontal distance from the reported location at which any UA in a group may be located (meters). Also allows defining the area where an Intent-Based Network Participant operation is taking place. Default: 0 m.
radius.caption: Radius

chunks_out.description: A unit of information within an SCTP packet, consisting of a chunk header and chunk-specific content. See RFC 4960. This field can be used for the chunks sent from the source to the destination.
chunks_out.caption: Chunks Out

tunnel_type.description: The tunnel type. See specific usage.
tunnel_type.caption: Type

url.description: The URL object that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.
url.caption: URL

num_violations.description: The number of times the policy or rule was violated.
num_violations.caption: Violations

install_state.description: The install state, normalized to the caption of install_state_id. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.
install_state.caption: Install State

share_type.description: The share type, normalized to the caption of the share_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.
share_type.caption: Share Type

compliance_standards.description: A list of established guidelines or criteria that define specific requirements an organization must follow.
compliance_standards.caption: Compliance Standards: Details

message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

is_cleartext.description:
Indicates whether the credentials were passed in clear text.

Note: True if the credentials were passed in a clear text protocol such as FTP or TELNET, or if Windows detected that a user's logon password was passed to the authentication package in clear text.

SCIM is defined in RFC-7634

An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs where each pair represents a file or folder extended attribute.

1.description: A dedicated agent or sensor installed on a device, either a dedicated data security tool or an Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies. E.g., Forcepoint DLP, Symantec DLP, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint (MDE).

8.description: A Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies in-line to cloud systems such as the public cloud or Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) tool. E.g., Forcepoint CASB, SkyHigh Security.

11.description: Any Developer Security tool such as an Infrastructure-as-Code (IAC) security scanner, Secrets Detection, or Secure Software Development Lifecycle (SSDLC) tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies. E.g., TruffleHog, GitGuardian, Git-Secrets.
11.caption: Developer Security

12.description: A Data Security Posture Management (DSPM) tool is a continuous monitoring and data discovery solution that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies for local and cloud environments. E.g., Cyera, Sentra, IBM Polar Security.

log_type.caption: Log Type

latency.description: The HTTP response latency measured in milliseconds.
latency.caption: Latency

desktop_display.description: The desktop display affiliated with the event
desktop_display.caption: Desktop Display

title.description: The title of an entity. See specific usage.
title.caption: Title

subdomain.description: The subdomain portion of the URL. For example: sub in https://sub.example.com or sub2.sub1 in https://sub2.sub1.example.com.
subdomain.caption: Subdomain

condition.description: The rule trigger condition for the rule. For example: SQL_INJECTION.
condition.caption: Condition

timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.
timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset

99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.
activity_id.caption: Activity ID

boot_time.description: The time when the system was booted.
boot_time.caption: Boot Time

duration_months.description: Represents the duration of the activity in months. See specific usage.
duration_months.caption: Duration Months

agent.description: An Agent (also known as a Sensor) is typically installed on an Operating System (OS) and serves as a specialized software component that can be designed to monitor, detect, collect, archive, or take action. These activities and possible actions are defined by the upstream system controlling the Agent and its intended purpose. For instance, an Agent can include Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) agents, backup/disaster recovery sensors, Application Performance Monitoring or profiling sensors, and similar software.
agent.caption: Agent

whois.description: The resources of a WHOIS record for a given domain. This can include domain names, IP address blocks, autonomous system information, and/or contact and registration information for a domain.
whois.caption: WHOIS

dmarc_policy.description: The Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) policy status.
dmarc_policy.caption: DMARC Policy

advisory.description: Detail about the security advisory, that is used to publicly disclose cybersecurity vulnerabilities by a vendor.
advisory.caption: Security Advisory

scan.description: The Scan object describes characteristics of a scan.  See specific usage.
scan.caption: Scan

tid.description: The Identifier of the thread associated with the event, as returned by the operating system.
tid.caption: Thread ID

uid_alt.description: The alternate unique identifier. See specific usage.
uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID

discovery_details.description: A collection of Discovery Details objects. See specific usage.
discovery_details.caption: Discovery Details

loggers.description: An array of Logger objects that describe the devices and logging products between the event source and its eventual destination. Note, this attribute can be used when there is a complex end-to-end path of event flow.
loggers.caption: Loggers

vulnerability.description: The vulnerability object describes details related to the observed vulnerability
vulnerability.caption: Vulnerability

type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.
type_name.caption: Type Name

namespace.description: The namespace is useful in merger or acquisition situations. For example, when similar entities exist that you need to keep separate.
namespace.caption: Namespace

logged_time_dt.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.
logged_time_dt.caption: Logged Time

kernel.description: The kernel resource object that pertains to the event.
kernel.caption: Kernel

dst_endpoint.description: The network destination endpoint.
dst_endpoint.caption: Destination Endpoint

terminated_time.description: The time when the entity was terminated. See specific usage.
terminated_time.caption: Terminated Time

finding_info_list.description: A list of finding_info objects associated to an incident.
finding_info_list.caption: Finding Information List

x_originating_ip.description: The X-Originating-IP header identifying the emails originating IP address(es).
x_originating_ip.caption: X-Originating-IP

content_type.description: The request header that identifies the original media type of the resource (prior to any content encoding applied for sending).
content_type.caption: HTTP Content Type

app.description: The application that reported the event.
app.caption: Application

duration_days.description: Represents the duration of the activity in days. See specific usage.
duration_days.caption: Duration Days

idle_timeout.description: Duration (in minutes) of allowed inactivity before a timeout See specific usage.
idle_timeout.caption: SSO Idle Timeout

traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network at a given point of time. Intended to be used alongside Network Connection.
traffic.caption: Traffic

to_mailboxes.description: The human-readable email header To Mailbox values. For example 'Example User <example.user@usersdomain.com>'.
to_mailboxes.caption: To Mailboxes

cost_center.description: The cost center associated with the user.
cost_center.caption: Cost Center

number.description: The number of the entity. See specific usage.
number.caption: Number

is_truncated.description: Indicates that an attribute has been truncated. See specific usage.
is_truncated.caption: Is Truncated

vector_string.description: The CVSS vector string is a text representation of a set of CVSS metrics. It is commonly used to record or transfer CVSS metric information in a concise form. For example: 3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:H.
vector_string.caption: Vector String

win/win_resource.description: The Windows resource object that was accessed, such as a mutant or timer.
win/win_resource.caption: Windows Resource

loaded_modules.description: The list of loaded module names.
loaded_modules.caption: Loaded Modules

network_interfaces.description:
The physical or virtual network interfaces that are associated with the device, one for each unique MAC address/IP address/hostname/name combination.

Note: The first element of the array is the network information that pertains to the event.
network_interfaces.caption: Network Interfaces

requested_permissions.description: The permissions mask. See specific usage.
requested_permissions.caption: Requested Permissions

99.description: The load type is not mapped. See the load_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

load_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the load type. See specific usage.
load_type_id.caption: Load Type ID

campaign.description: The campaign object describes details about the campaign that was the source of the activity.
campaign.caption: Campaign

database.description: The database object is used for databases which are typically datastore services that contain an organized collection of structured and unstructured data or a types of data.
database.caption: Database

meets_criteria.description: Determines if an assessment, control, policy, or otherwise meets its assessment criteria. See specific usage.
meets_criteria.caption: Meets Criteria

is_user_provisioning_enabled.description: Indicates whether user provisioning is automated (e.g., for a SCIM resource). See specific usage.
is_user_provisioning_enabled.caption: User Provisioning Enabled

sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the firewall rule in the matched event. For example: HIGH.

modified_time_dt.description: The time when the object was last modified. See specific usage.
modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time

transmit_time_dt.description: The event transmission time from one device to another.  See specific usage.
transmit_time_dt.caption: Transmission Time

anomalies.description: A list of detected anomalies or deviations from expected behavior patterns. See specific usage.
anomalies.caption: Anomalies

certificate_chain.description: The Chain of Certificate Serial Numbers field provides a chain of Certificate Issuer Serial Numbers leading to the Root Certificate Issuer.
certificate_chain.caption: Certificate Chain

unmanned_aerial_system.description: The Unmanned Aerial System object describes the characteristics, Position Location Information (PLI), and other metadata of Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS) and other unmanned and drone systems used in Remote ID. Remote ID is defined in the Standard Specification for Remote ID and Tracking (ASTM Designation: F3411-22a) ASTM F3411-22a.
unmanned_aerial_system.caption: Unmanned Aerial System

packets_in.description: The number of packets sent from the destination to the source.
packets_in.caption: Packets In

unmanned_system_operating_area.description: The UAS Operating Area object describes details about a precise area of operations for a UAS flight or mission.
unmanned_system_operating_area.caption: UAS Operating Area

modified_time.description: The time when the object was last modified. See specific usage.
modified_time.caption: Modified Time

detection_pattern.description: Specific pattern, algorithm, fingerprint, or model used for detection.
detection_pattern.caption: Detection Pattern

section_a.description: The 'a' section of the JA4 fingerprint.
section_a.caption: JA4 Section A

3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.
3.caption: Quarantined

6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.
6.caption: Dropped

1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.
1.caption: Allowed

2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.
2.caption: Blocked

99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.
4.caption: Isolated

5.description: A file or other content was deleted.
5.caption: Deleted

7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.
7.caption: Custom Action

8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.
8.caption: Approved

9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.
9.caption: Restored

10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).
10.caption: Exonerated

11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.
11.caption: Corrected

12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.
12.caption: Partially Corrected

14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.
14.caption: Delayed

15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.
15.caption: Detected

16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.
16.caption: No Action

17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.
17.caption: Logged

18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.
18.caption: Tagged

20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.
20.caption: Count

21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.
21.caption: Reset

22.caption: Captcha

24.caption: Access Revoked

25.caption: Rejected

26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.
26.caption: Unauthorized

27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.
27.caption: Error

13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.
13.caption: Uncorrected

19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.
19.caption: Alert

disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

3.description: The drive is a remote (network) drive.

3.description: The socket has passively received a connection request from a remote peer.
3.caption: SYN-RECEIVED

6.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application, the remote peer has closed its half of the connection, and the system is waiting to be sure that the remote peer received the last acknowledgement.
6.caption: TIME-WAIT

1.description: The socket has an established connection between a local application and a remote peer.
1.caption: ESTABLISHED

2.description: The socket is actively trying to establish a connection to a remote peer.
2.caption: SYN-SENT

4.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application, the remote peer has not yet acknowledged the close, and the system is waiting for it to close its half of the connection.
4.caption: FIN-WAIT-1

5.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application, the remote peer has acknowledged the close, and the system is waiting for it to close its half of the connection.
5.caption: FIN-WAIT-2

7.description: The socket is not in use.
7.caption: CLOSED

8.description: The socket connection has been closed by the remote peer, and the system is waiting for the local application to close its half of the connection.
8.caption: CLOSE-WAIT

9.description: The socket connection has been closed by the remote peer, the local application has closed its half of the connection, and the system is waiting for the remote peer to acknowledge the close.
9.caption: LAST-ACK

10.description: The socket is listening for incoming connections.
10.caption: LISTEN

11.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application and the remote peer simultaneously, and the remote peer has not yet acknowledged the close attempt of the local application.
11.caption: CLOSING
